neighborhoods.name: Gornji Grad
neighborhoods.character: A charming medieval neighborhood perched on a hill, featuring cobblestone streets, historic churches, and stunning views of the city below.

location.description: Located on a hill in the historic center of Zagreb, connected to the Lower Town by the funicular and stairs.

history.overview: Originally a medieval settlement, it became the political and religious center of Zagreb in the 13th century.
history.significance: Home to the Croatian Parliament and the oldest surviving buildings in Zagreb.
notable_events: Construction of St. Mark's Church (13th century)

practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant tourist presence and police patrols
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Early morning for photos, afternoon for exploration, evening for dining
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable but with steep inclines and cobblestone streets

attractions.name: St. Mark's Church
attractions.description: Famous for its colorful tiled roof featuring the coats of arms of Croatia, Dalmatia, Slavonia, and Zagreb.
attractions.appeal: Iconic symbol of Zagreb and one of the most photographed buildings in Croatia.

attractions.name: Lotrščak Tower
attractions.description: 13th-century tower where a cannon is fired daily at noon, a tradition since 1877.
attractions.appeal: Climb to the top for panoramic views of Zagreb and witness the daily cannon firing.

attractions.name: Stone Gate
attractions.description: The only remaining gate from Zagreb's medieval fortifications, now a shrine to the Virgin Mary.
attractions.appeal: Experience the spiritual heart of Zagreb and its miraculous icon.

dining.name: Restaurant 4
dining.known_for: Modern interpretations of traditional Croatian dishes

dining.name: Vinodol
dining.known_for: Classic Croatian cuisine and local wines

activities.name: Medieval Walking Tour
activities.description: Explore the medieval streets, churches, and historic buildings of Upper Town.

activities.name: Funicular Ride
activities.description: Take the historic funicular connecting Upper and Lower Town.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the heart of historic Zagreb
You enjoy medieval architecture and atmosphere
You want easy access to major historic attractions
avoid_if: You have mobility issues (steep hills and stairs)
You prefer modern amenities and services
insider_tips: Visit early morning to avoid crowds and get the best photos
Time your visit to hear the noon cannon from Lotrščak Tower
Many restaurants offer better prices away from the main squares

neighborhoods.name: Donji Grad
neighborhoods.character: A vibrant commercial and cultural district with elegant Austro-Hungarian architecture, museums, and the city's main square.

location.description: The main commercial and cultural district of Zagreb, featuring grand squares, museums, and shopping streets.

history.overview: Developed in the 19th century as Zagreb's modern commercial center, featuring grand Austro-Hungarian architecture.
history.significance: Represents Zagreb's transformation into a modern European capital with cultural institutions and commerce.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant activity and police presence
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for shopping, afternoon for museums, evening for dining and nightlife
practical_info.walkability: Highly walkable with wide sidewalks and pedestrian areas

attractions.name: Ban Jelačić Square
attractions.description: The central square of Zagreb featuring the equestrian statue of Ban Jelačić and surrounded by historic buildings.
attractions.appeal: The heart of Zagreb's social and commercial life, perfect for people-watching.

attractions.name: Croatian National Theatre
attractions.description: Magnificent Austro-Hungarian theater building hosting opera, ballet, and drama performances.
attractions.appeal: Experience world-class performances in a stunning historic venue.

attractions.name: Zrinjevac Park
attractions.description: Beautiful park with fountains, monuments, and seasonal flower displays.
attractions.appeal: Peaceful green space perfect for relaxation and photography.

dining.name: Restaurant Dubravkin Put
dining.known_for: Creative Croatian cuisine and extensive wine list

activities.name: Museum Hopping
activities.description: Visit the numerous museums including the Museum of Broken Relationships and Croatian National Museum.

activities.name: Shopping Spree
activities.description: Explore the shopping streets including Ilica, the longest street in Zagreb.

stay_here_if: You want to be in the center of Zagreb's commercial and cultural life
You enjoy shopping, dining, and cultural activities
You want easy access to public transportation
avoid_if: You want to be away from crowds and tourist activity
insider_tips: Visit museums on free admission days (usually first Sunday of the month)
Explore side streets for authentic local restaurants away from tourist areas
Check out the seasonal flower displays in Zrinjevac Park

neighborhoods.name: Kaptol
neighborhoods.character: A historic religious district centered around Zagreb's magnificent cathedral, featuring ecclesiastical architecture and peaceful atmosphere.

location.description: Located between Upper and Lower Town, centered around Zagreb Cathedral and ecclesiastical buildings.

history.overview: The ecclesiastical heart of Zagreb since the Middle Ages, home to the archbishop and cathedral.
history.significance: Represents Zagreb's religious heritage and the seat of the Catholic Church in Croatia.

transit: Walking distance from both Upper and Lower Town
practical_info.safety: Very safe with religious and tourist presence
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Morning for market, afternoon for cathedral visits, evening for peaceful walks
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with historic streets and squares

attractions.name: Zagreb Cathedral
attractions.description: Magnificent Gothic cathedral with twin spires, the tallest building in Croatia.
attractions.appeal: Explore the spiritual heart of Zagreb and admire stunning Gothic architecture.

attractions.name: Dolac Market
attractions.description: Famous open-air market known as 'Zagreb's stomach' with fresh produce and local products.
attractions.appeal: Experience authentic local life and find fresh ingredients and traditional products.

attractions.name: Archbishop's Palace
attractions.description: Elegant palace housing the archbishop and ecclesiastical administration.
attractions.appeal: Admire beautiful architecture and learn about Zagreb's religious history.

dining.name: Restaurant Kaptol
dining.known_for: Classic Croatian dishes in historic setting

dining.name: Market Café
dining.known_for: Coffee and pastries near Dolac Market

activities.name: Cathedral Tour
activities.description: Visit the magnificent Zagreb Cathedral and learn about its history.

activities.name: Market Shopping
activities.description: Explore Dolac Market for fresh produce, flowers, and local products.

stay_here_if: You want to be near religious and historic sites
You want easy access to fresh markets
avoid_if: You prefer vibrant nightlife and entertainment
You want to be away from tourist crowds
You seek modern amenities and services
insider_tips: Visit Dolac Market early morning for the freshest produce and authentic experience
Attend mass at the cathedral for a spiritual experience
Many restaurants offer traditional Croatian dishes near the market

neighborhoods.name: Maksimir
neighborhoods.character: A peaceful residential area centered around Zagreb's largest and oldest public park, offering nature, recreation, and family-friendly atmosphere.

location.description: Located east of the city center, featuring Maksimir Park and surrounding residential neighborhoods.

history.overview: Developed around Maksimir Park, created in the 18th century as one of the first public parks in Europe.
history.significance: Represents Zagreb's commitment to green spaces and recreational areas for its citizens.

practical_info.safety: Very safe residential area with family atmosphere
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Spring and summer for park activities, year-round for zoo visits
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with park paths and good sidewalks

attractions.name: Maksimir Park
attractions.description: Zagreb's largest and oldest public park with lakes, walking paths, and beautiful landscaping.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for walking, jogging, picnics, and enjoying nature in the city.

attractions.name: Zagreb Zoo
attractions.description: Located within Maksimir Park, featuring diverse animal species and educational programs.
attractions.appeal: Great family activity with educational value and animal encounters.

attractions.name: Echo Pavilion
attractions.description: Beautiful historic pavilion in Maksimir Park with acoustic properties.
attractions.appeal: Historic architecture and unique acoustic experience in natural setting.

dining.name: Zoo Café
dining.known_for: Coffee and light meals near the zoo

activities.name: Park Walking
activities.description: Explore the extensive walking paths and natural areas of Maksimir Park.

activities.name: Zoo Visit
activities.description: Visit the Zagreb Zoo to see diverse animal species and learn about wildlife.

stay_here_if: You want a peaceful, family-friendly environment
You enjoy nature and outdoor activities
You prefer residential areas away from city bustle
avoid_if: You want to be in the heart of Zagreb's cultural and commercial life
You prefer vibrant nightlife and entertainment
You want immediate access to major tourist attractions
insider_tips: Visit the park early morning for peaceful walks and bird watching
The zoo is less crowded on weekdays
Bring a picnic to enjoy in the park's beautiful natural setting

neighborhoods.name: Jarun
neighborhoods.character: A vibrant recreational area centered around Jarun Lake, offering water sports, cycling, and outdoor activities with a lively atmosphere.

location.description: Located southwest of the city center, featuring Jarun Lake and surrounding recreational facilities.

history.overview: Developed as a recreational area in the 1980s, transforming former agricultural land into a popular leisure destination.
history.significance: Represents Zagreb's modern approach to urban recreation and outdoor activities.

practical_info.safety: Very safe with constant recreational activity
practical_info.best_time_to_visit: Spring and summer for water activities, year-round for cycling and walking
practical_info.walkability: Very walkable with extensive paths and cycling routes

attractions.name: Jarun Lake
attractions.description: Artificial lake perfect for swimming, rowing, and water sports activities.
attractions.appeal: Excellent water recreation and sports opportunities in natural setting.

attractions.name: Cycling Paths
attractions.description: Extensive network of cycling paths around the lake and surrounding areas.
attractions.appeal: Perfect for cycling enthusiasts and family bike rides.

attractions.name: Sports Facilities
attractions.description: Various sports facilities including tennis courts, football fields, and fitness areas.
attractions.appeal: Active recreation and sports activities for all ages.

activities.name: Water Sports
activities.description: Enjoy swimming, rowing, and various water sports on Jarun Lake.

activities.name: Cycling
activities.description: Explore the extensive cycling paths around the lake and surrounding areas.

stay_here_if: You enjoy outdoor activities and sports
You want a peaceful, nature-focused environment
You prefer active recreation over cultural activities
avoid_if: You want to be in the heart of Zagreb's cultural and historic attractions
You prefer urban atmosphere and nightlife
You seek immediate access to major tourist sites
insider_tips: Visit early morning for peaceful cycling and fewer crowds
Bring your own sports equipment for the best experience
The lake is perfect for picnics and family activities
